title: What are some words that mean different things to different people? - Quora

response.answer_text: The following are some "deeper" words that mean different things to different people: God, faith, love, right, wrong, true, happiness, success. Those are just the first few that came to mind, but if you ask a variety of people from around the world what those words mean to them, the responses would vary.

You may wish to further clarify whether you want Homonyms - i.e. same spelling and pronunciation, but different meaning, as in:  A receiver  A receiver  A receiver Or Homographs - i.e. same spelling, but different pronunciation and meaning, as in:  Two typical bows  Two typical bows Goggling Homonym or Homograph will probably provide you with lists of examples of either ;-).
